content:
# elizaos/elizaos.github.io Daily Update (Jan 9, 2026)
## OVERVIEW 
The day focused on planning future feature development, with a significant number of new issues opened to outline the implementation of a comprehensive Orders and Evolution class system, including user choice, visual identity, and configurable thresholds.

## KEY TECHNICAL DEVELOPMENTS

No code changes, bug fixes, or documentation enhancements were completed today.

## NEWLY OPENED PULL REQUESTS
No new pull requests were opened today.

## CLOSED ISSUES
No issues were closed today.

## NEW ISSUES

### Planning for Orders and Evolution System
New issues were opened to detail the implementation of a comprehensive Orders and Evolution class system. This includes defining the full class tree from "CONTRIBUTOR" to advanced roles like "Architect" and "Maintainer" [#194], allowing users to choose their evolution path at tier thresholds [#195], and tracking class transitions for rich profile lore display [#196].

### Enhancing Visuals and Customization for Orders
Further planning includes adding a unique visual identity system for each Order, specifying primary colors, accents, and sigils for UI display [#197]. Additionally, the system will allow users to respec their class with history preservation and cooldown periods [#198], and make character class thresholds configurable via `config/example.json` [#199].

### Improving Report Readability
A new issue proposes extending the grouped organization/repository format, currently used for lifetime summaries, to daily, weekly, and monthly summaries to enhance readability for contributors with multiple repositories [#200].

## ACTIVE ISSUES
No active issues with more than 3 comments.
